(–∞—É–¥–∏–æ), AVI (–∞—É–¥–∏–æ), iTunes/Windows Media (–Ω–µ DRM).\r\n* –ù–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π DSD (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–º—É—é –∏–ª–∏ DoP), DXD  (–≤ –≠–∫—Å–∫–ª—é–∑–∏–≤–Ω–æ–º –†–µ–∂–∏–º–µ, –ü–ö).\r\n* –î–µ–∫–æ–¥–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ DSD –≤ PCM.\r\n* –ú–æ–¥—É–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∞—É–¥–∏–æ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç—ã: MOD, IM, XM, S3M.\r\n* –ì–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤–æ–π –∞—É–¥–∏–æ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç: SPEEX.\r\n* –ü–ª–µ–π–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã: CUE, M3U, PLS, ASX, RAM, XSPF, WPL.\r\n* –õ–∏—Ä–∏–∫–∞ (.LRC —Ñ–∞–π–ª—ã, –º–µ—Ç–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ).\r\n* –ü–æ—Ç–æ–∫–æ–≤–æ–µ –∞—É–¥–∏–æ (–∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–¥–∏–æ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–∫–∏, Icecast).\r\n* –ü–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∞ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏—Ö –º–µ–¥–∏–∞—Ç–µ–∫.\r\n? –°–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã–µ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –º—É–∑—ã–∫–∏ (–¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ—Ö '?' —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ see –ü–†–ò–ú–ï–ß–ê–ù–ò–ï –Ω–∏–∂–µ):\r\n  - SMB/CIFS c–µ—Ç–µ–≤–æ–µ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ (NAS –∏–ª–∏ –ü–ö, Samba —à–∞—Ä–∏–Ω–≥);\r\n  - UPnP/DLNA –ú–µ–¥–∏–∞—Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä;\r\n  - FTP —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä;\r\n  - WebDAV —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä.\r\n? –í—ã–≤–æ–¥ –Ω–∞ Chromecast (–¥–æ 24-–±–∏—Ç, 192 –∫–ì—Ü, –±–µ–∑ –æ–≥—Ä. —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∞ –∏–ª–∏ –¶–û–° —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤).\r\n? –í—ã–≤–æ–¥ –Ω–∞ UPnP/DLNA –ú–µ–¥–∏–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–µ—Ä (–¥–æ 24-–±–∏—Ç, 768 –∫–ì—Ü, –±–µ–∑ –æ–≥—Ä. —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∞ –∏–ª–∏ –¶–û–° —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤).\r\n* –ü—Ä—è–º–æ–π –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥ –Ω–∞ USB –¶–ê–ü (—á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ USB OTG –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–µ—Ä, –¥–æ 32-–±–∏—Ç, 768 –∫–ì—Ü, —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –≠–∫—Å–∫–ª—é–∑–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –†–µ–∂–∏–º).\r\n* 32-—Ö –±–∏—Ç–Ω—ã–π –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥ (IEEE 754, –æ–ø—Ü–∏—è).\r\n? UPnP/DLNA –ú–µ–¥–∏–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–µ—Ä–µ—Ä —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä (–±–µ—Å—à–æ–≤–Ω–æ–µ, –¶–û–° —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—ã).\r\n* –¶–û–° —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç—ã:\r\n  - –ü–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –≠–∫–≤–∞–ª–∞–π–∑–µ—Ä (4-30 –ø–æ–ª–æ—Å–Ω—ã–π, –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–π: —Ç–∏–ø, —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ—Ç–∞, Q, –≥—Ä–æ–º–∫–æ—Å—Ç—å);\r\n  - –†–µ–∂–∏–º –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –≠–∫–≤–∞–ª–∞–π–∑–µ—Ä–∞ —Å 21-–º –ø—Ä–µ—Å–µ—Ç–æ–º;\r\n  - –û–±—ä—ë–º–Ω—ã–π –ó–≤—É–∫ (Ambiophonic R.A.C.E.);\r\n  - –ö—Ä–æ—Å—Ñ–∏–¥–µ—Ä (—É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏—è —Å—Ç–µ—Ä–µ–æ –∑–≤—É—á–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –Ω–∞—É—à–Ω–∏–∫–∞—Ö);\r\n –¶–û–° —Ñ–∏–ª—å—Ç—Ä);\r\n  - –î–∏–∑–µ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥ (—Å–≥–ª–∞–∂–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –∫–≤–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è);\r\n  - –¢–µ–º–ø, –í—ã—Å–æ—Ç–∞ –∑–≤—É–∫–∞ (–∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ü–∏—è —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏ the new free music app MUSIC MAKER JAM for Windows you can make your own amazing tracks - it's fun and fast! Simply start the app, choose three free music styles and start combining sounds to make your own songs.\r\nChoose from a wide range of professionally produced loops and arrange them any way you want on up to eight tracks. Change the tempo, adjust the pitch and mix your songs using cool realtime effects. Ready for a remix? Just shake your tablet to reorder the tracks and create a unique version of your song. It's a great way to find some inspiration for your next jam session!\r\n\r\nMUSIC MAKER JAM offers intuitive control making music production even more fun and easy than you ever imagined. All of the sounds are perfectly synchronized to keep you on the beat every step of the way.\r\nThe app comes with four free styles. One of those is Dubstep, the other three are your choice and can be changed every month. This means that you have new loops on a monthly basis to keep your jams fresh and give you absolute freedom to experiment with your sound. And if that's not enough, you can also expand your studio with new premium styles like Hip Hop, Drum&Bass, Techno, Movie Score, House, Metal and many more. In fact, there's so much to mix and match you can take things to the next level and create your own new music genre!\r\nWhether a quiet instrumental, a guitar-driven rocker for the radio or a pulsating dance track for the club, this app makes it all possible. Extraction of files from other widely used archive formats is also supported.\r\nOriginal, double tree program interface allows to manipulate simultaneously several archives and to minimize the number of operations while working with archives.\r\nWork with items of archives is similar to work with files and folders in Windows Explorer. Besides, AX-ZIP Archiver is simple and convenient file manager.\r\n\r\nMain Features\r\n\r\nFull support of ZIP archives.\r\nExtraction from CAB, RAR, JAR, XAP, GZIP, BZIP2, TAR and 7Z archives.\r\nExtraction from ISO images (ISO 9660 and ISO 13346 \"UDF\").\r\nStrong AES encryption (with key length of 128, 192 and 256 bits).\r\nSimultaneous work with several archives.\r\nOne drag creation of archives and adding of files.\r\nOne drag extraction of files from archive.\r\nDeletion and renaming of files and folders in the archive.\r\nCreation of folders in the archive.\r\nSearch of archives and files within the archives.\r\nBookmarks for archives and files in the archives.\r\nSupport of cloud drives and special folders.\r\nSupport of main file manager functions.\r\nSupport of drag and drop technology.\r\nDisplay of archive structure as a tree.\r\nFamiliar Explorer-like user interface.\r\n\r\nOverview\r\n\r\nAX-ZIP utility views ZIP archives and archives of other types as folders containing folders and files whose structure is shown as a tree. Thus the root folder of archive will be displayed as an icon associated with archives of that type.\r\nAX-ZIP Archiver working space is made up of two windows - Archive Browser and File Browser.\r\nArchive Browser contains a tree representing the structure of disks, folders and archives - files with extension of supported archive types. To open archive one should simply click \"+\" sign situated on the left of archive name.\r\nFile Browser shows full structure of disks, folders and files.\r\nAll operations in AX-ZIP Archiver concerning archive management involve dragging of items from one window to the other.\r\n\r\nWhat's New in Version 4.3\r\n\r\nThe new mode of unpacking is added - when dragging from an external source of the supported archive to the File Browser folder, it will be unpacked.\r\nThe button ‚ÄúExtract‚Äù on toolbar Archive Browser is added - to unpack the allocated archive or its item in the selected File Browser folder.\r\nThe button ‚ÄúCreate or Add‚Äù on toolbar File Browser is added - to add the selected file or the folder to the selected zip-archive Archive Browser or to create new zip-archive in the selected folder Archive Browser.\r\nThe support of the cloud drive Box Sync is added.\r\nThe support of the cloud drive of SugarSync is added.\r\nThe rules for passwords are added.\r\nThe tool for splitting the file into parts is added.\r\nThe tool for merge files into one file is added.\r\nThe performance of some operations is –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å –∏–∑ 11 —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–≤ –∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑ —Ç–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ –¥–≤—É—Ö —è–∑—ã–∫–∞—Ö –æ–¥–Ω–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ.\r\n\r\n–ú—ã—à–µ—á–Ω–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–π Once it's activated, you can drag or swipe the terminal screen to view previous lines (scroll-back mode is automatically triggered by dragging or swiping in full window mode).\r\n- On-screen keyboard is activated when you tap the cursor in Mobile devices.\r\n- In Mobile devices, tapping a session tab and closing its popup menu without selecting any menu (ex. pressing the Back button) also activates the on-screen keyboard.\r\n- Some features are disabled or hidden for Windows 10 Mobile devices based on its available memory (ex. background option may not available on smartphones with less than 2GB of memory).\r\n\r\n// RECENT IMPROVEMENTS\r\n\r\n- \"Clear Scrollback\" is added under the \"Terminal\" menu. If you want to save some previous lines, you can scroll back (SHIFT+UP) first and then select the menu; the text line buffer is cleared up to the currently visible top line.\r\n- ALT+SHIFT+P now takes a snapshot of a terminal window with its title bar and frame border. If you just want the content area, press ALT+P.\r\n- Layout Freezer is added for saving and restoring the layout of opened terminal windows\r\n- New cipher \"chacha20-poly1305@openssh.com\" is added\r\n- TCP Direct connection method now supports TLS 1.2 encryption and can be used for directly connecting to HTTPS servers\r\n- More host key types are added: ecdsa-sha2-nistp256, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384, ecdsa-sha2-nistp521, ssh-ed25519\r\n- More key exchange algorithms are added: curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256\r\n- Now supports Bluetooth/RFCOMM communication. This feature can be handy when you're developing or debugging a custom Bluetooth service for IoT devices.
